content_index.sheet_name: Improve My Relationship with My Child

Improve My Relationship with My Child.module_name: Spend One-on-one Time with My Girl or Boy
Improve My Relationship with My Child.introduction.msg_list: Today‚Äôs lesson is about spending one-on-one time with Your Child üòÉ
Improve My Relationship with My Child.quiz.content.1.question: True or False: When I spend special time with my boy or girl, I need to have a plan. I need to know what we will do together.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
üéâ You are right! 

üß∏ Your child can choose the activity as long as it is safe. This will increase their confidence and make it more likely that they enjoy their time with you.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
üëÄ Oops! Good Try!

üß∏ You do not have to plan an activity. Your boy or girl can lead! Let them choose as long as it is safe. This will increase their confidence and make it more likely that they enjoy their time with you.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.intro: {F1_SON_5} and his mother, {F1_MOTHER}, are playing dress up during one-on-one time. Let‚Äôs see how they have fun together:
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.text.1:
{F1_MOTHER}: I have 5 minutes of one-on-one time to spend with you, {F1_SON_5}. What would you like to do?
{F1_SON_5}: I want to play dress up!
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.text.2: {F1_MOTHER}: Wonderful idea, {F1_SON_5}! I see you are taking out the yellow handkerchief with blue stripes on it.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.text.3:
{F1_SON_5}: Mom, it‚Äôs for you.
{F1_MOTHER}: Thank you, I love it!
{F1_SON_5}: Wear it Mom!
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.text.4: {F1_MOTHER}: Look how good you are at getting dressed by yourself!
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.intro: 3Ô∏è‚É£ Here are three tips to remember when spending one-on-one time with Your Child: DAY, PLAY, and STAY.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.1.text:
1Ô∏è‚É£ *DAY - Try to do it every day*

‚è∞ Spend 5 minutes (or more!) with Your Child each day.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.2.text:
2Ô∏è‚É£ *PLAY - Let them choose the activity*

‚è∞ Ask to spend time with Your Child.
‚öΩ Let them choose what to do or talk about.

üéàTry different activities together.

üòÉ Have fun!
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.3.text:
3Ô∏è‚É£ *STAY - Focus on Your Child*

üì∫ Switch off the TV, put aside phones, and remove distractions.

üëÄ Look at Your Child. Nod or say ‚ÄúI see‚Äù to show you are really paying attention. 

üíõ Accept your boy or girl and avoid judgement.

üí° Respond to your girl or boy when they communicate with you. Your Child may use gestures, full sentences, movements, and sounds to communicate with you. It shows you are really paying attention to them.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.video.message:
Press Play ‚ñ∂Ô∏è to learn 3Ô∏è‚É£ three tips to remember when spending one-on-one time with Your Child

1Ô∏è‚É£ DAY - Try to do it every day
2Ô∏è‚É£ PLAY - Let them choose the activity
3Ô∏è‚É£ STAY - Focus on your boy or girl
Improve My Relationship with My Child.audio.message:
Press Play ‚ñ∂Ô∏è to learn 3Ô∏è‚É£ three tips to remember when spending one-on-one time with Your Child

1Ô∏è‚É£ DAY - Try to do it every day
2Ô∏è‚É£ PLAY - Let them choose the activity
3Ô∏è‚É£ STAY - Focus on your boy or girl
Improve My Relationship with My Child.home_activity.activity: Home Activity! ‚≠ê Try to spend at least 5 minutes of quality one-on-one time with Your Child every day. It will make such a difference! Do you have time to do it today? ‚è∞
Improve My Relationship with My Child.home_activity.positive_msg: Great! Use the tips you have learnt today and have fun! Spending one-on-one time with Your Child is a great way to form a positive relationship with them. üíô
Improve My Relationship with My Child.home_activity.negative_msg: That's OK! If you don't have time today, set some time aside tomorrow.

Improve My Relationship with My Child.introduction.msg_list:
‚ú®Well done for the effort of learning how to improve your relationship with Your Child. It shows you really care! üíô
;
üòÉHow did the message above make you feel?
üå∑We all feel better when we are praised.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.importance.msg_list:
üèÖPraising Your Child when they behave in the expected way will make them want to behave that way more often. 

‚≠êIt also creates a positive and loving relationship between you and Your Child.

Begin by praising Your Child during one-on-one time.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.quiz.content.1.question: True or False: The way you praise Your Child does not matter because any kind of praise is effective.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
üéâ You are right! 

‚ú® How you praise your child is important. Praise should be specific, immediate, and genuine. 

üå± You can begin by praising your child for the smallest things, such as playing by themselves quietly for 2 minutes.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
üëÄ Oops! Good Try!

‚ú® How you praise your child is important. Praise should be specific, immediate, and genuine. 

üå± You can begin by praising your child for the smallest things, such as playing by themselves quietly for 2 minutes.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.intro: Let‚Äôs check in on {F3_MOTHER} and her son, {F3_SON_4}, to see how she praises him during one-on-one time.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.text.1: {F3_MOTHER}: You found a striped sock and one with dots. Let‚Äôs find the socks that match those two.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.text.2: {F3_MOTHER}: Another sock! This one is white. It isn‚Äôt easy finding a matching pair. It can be frustrating.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.text.3: {F3_MOTHER}: You are being very patient and looking very hard, {F3_SON_4}. Good for trying.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.text.4: {F3_MOTHER}: You found matching socks of the same pattern! Well done for looking, {F3_SON_4}!
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.intro:
‚≠ê Children who are praised for their effort and good behaviour will want to keep behaving well and keep receiving praise. 

4Ô∏è‚É£ Here are 4 simple tips for praising Your Child:
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.1.text:
1Ô∏è‚É£ SEE IT

üëÄ Look for anything good or helpful Your Child does.

‚è∏ Pause and really notice when they are doing something positive.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.2.text:
2Ô∏è‚É£ SAY IT

üèÜ Praise them when you see them do something you like.
‚úÖ Tell them specifically what they have done well.
üéâ Be enthusiastic and really mean it!
üîÑ This means they are more likely to do it again.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.3.text:
3Ô∏è‚É£ REPEAT IT

üå∑ Look for something to praise Your Child for every day.
üî∂ Even if it is something really small, keep doing it.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.4.text:
4Ô∏è‚É£ KEEP IT POSITIVE

üí° Make sure you focus on something Your Child has done well.
üôÇYou can show your praise with a big smile and words. You can also clap, hug, or tickle Your Child to show you appreciate them.
‚òÄÔ∏è Keeping it positive reminds Your Child that you notice them and care.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.video.message:
‚≠ê Children who are praised for their effort and good behaviour will want to keep behaving well and keep receiving praise. 

Press Play ‚ñ∂Ô∏è to learn 4Ô∏è‚É£ the four tips for giving Your Child praise.

1Ô∏è‚É£ SEE IT
2Ô∏è‚É£ SAY IT
3Ô∏è‚É£ REPEAT IT
4Ô∏è‚É£ KEEP IT POSITIVE
Improve My Relationship with My Child.audio.message:
‚≠ê Children who are praised for their effort and good behaviour will want to keep behaving well and keep receiving praise. 

Press Play ‚ñ∂Ô∏è to learn 4Ô∏è‚É£ the four tips for giving Your Child praise.

1Ô∏è‚É£ SEE IT
2Ô∏è‚É£ SAY IT
3Ô∏è‚É£ REPEAT IT
4Ô∏è‚É£ KEEP IT POSITIVE
Improve My Relationship with My Child.home_activity.activity: Your Home Activity today is to try to praise Your Child during one-on-one time. Can you do it today?
Improve My Relationship with My Child.home_activity.positive_msg: Amazing! üéâ Try to praise Your Child at least once during one-on-one Time. You can also praise Your Child at other times during the day. Notice how they respond.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.home_activity.negative_msg: üíö That's OK! Sometimes things take time. You can review this lesson in the Main Menu at any time. At the end of the day, think of all of the positive things that happened - this makes it easier to point them out. ‚òÄÔ∏è With time, praise will come easily to you.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.congratulations.msg_list:
Well done! ‚≠ê You have now learnt the four steps to Praise. 
You have completed @(fields.c_n_mod_compl +1) out of @fields.c_n_mod lessons in the course, Improve my Relationship with My Child. ‚≠ê

Improve My Relationship with My Child.module_name: Create a Routine for one-on-one Time
Improve My Relationship with My Child.introduction.msg_list: This lesson is about creating routines for spending one-on-one time with Your Child. üîÑ
Improve My Relationship with My Child.importance.msg_list:
To continue building a positive relationship with Your Child, let‚Äôs make one-on-one time a part of the routine. 

You can use the tips for one-on-one routines to create other daily routines with Your Child. 

Creating daily routines with Your Child will also help them feel more secure, safe and cooperative. üîë Help them plan time for resting, meals, chores, school, and sleep. ‚è∞
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.intro: {F2_GRANDMOTHER} includes one-on-one time with her granddaughter as part of her bedtime routine, {F2_DAUGHTER_3}. Let‚Äôs see how they do it together!
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.text.1:
{F2_GRANDMOTHER}: I am so happy to see you playing quietly with your blocks, {F2_DAUGHTER_3}. When I come back, it will be time to get ready for bed. When you are ready for bed, we can have 5 minutes of One-on-One Time together.

{F2_DAUGHTER_3}: Okay!
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.text.2: {F2_GRANDMOTHER}: Time to get ready for bed. First, let‚Äôs get you a nice body wash.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.text.3: {F2_GRANDMOTHER}: You were so well-behaved in the bath, {F2_DAUGHTER_3}. Now it is time to put on your Pajamas .
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.text.4: {F2_GRANDMOTHER}: Well done for getting in your pajamas all by yourself, {F2_DAUGHTER_3}! Now you brush your teeth. Make sure you get the ones in the back of your mouth!
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.text.5:
{F2_GRANDMOTHER}: You were so cooperative while getting ready for bed! Now we have 5 minutes of one-on-one time to spend together. What would you like to do?

{F2_DAUGHTER_3}: Yay! Can you read me my favourite storybook?
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.text.6:
{F2_GRANDMOTHER}: ‚ÄúThe end‚Ä¶.‚Äù Such a lovely story! Goodnight my darling girl. I love you very much.

{F2_DAUGHTER_3}: Goodnight, Grandma
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.intro: 3Ô∏è‚É£ Here are three tips on how to create routines with Your Child.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.1.text:
1Ô∏è‚É£ BE A TEAM
üéà Talk to Your Child about what they want their routines to look like.
‚ú® Did you know that Your Child is more likely to follow routines when they help to set them? Try it out! üíö
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.2.text:
2Ô∏è‚É£ BE CONSISTENT
‚è∞ Make sure Your Child follows their routines daily.
üå± Activities become easier to manage when children learn and get used to a routine.
üîÑ Consistent routines help Your Child learn how to do daily activities by themselves and how to manage their time.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.3.text:
3Ô∏è‚É£ PRAISE, PRAISE, PRAISE
üèÖPraise Your Child for setting a routine with you.
‚≠ê Praise Your Child when they follow the routine.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.4.text:
Here are some other routines you could talk about with Your Child in addition to one-on-one Time:

‚úÖ Bedtime
‚úÖ Schoolwork
‚úÖ Chores
‚úÖ Mealtime
‚úÖ Free time
‚úÖ TV or gadget time
Improve My Relationship with My Child.video.message:
Press Play ‚ñ∂Ô∏è to learn 3Ô∏è‚É£ three tips to create a daily routine around one-on-one time with Your Child

1Ô∏è‚É£ BE A TEAM
2Ô∏è‚É£ BE CONSISTENT
3Ô∏è‚É£ PRAISE, PRAISE, PRAISE
Improve My Relationship with My Child.audio.message:
Press Play ‚ñ∂Ô∏è to learn 3Ô∏è‚É£three tips to create a daily routine around 1-on-1 time with Your Child

1Ô∏è‚É£ BE A TEAM
2Ô∏è‚É£ BE CONSISTENT
3Ô∏è‚É£ PRAISE, PRAISE, PRAISE
Improve My Relationship with My Child.home_activity.activity: Home Activity! Try to create a routine around spending 5 minutes of one-on-one time with Your Child every day. üìù Can you do it today?
Improve My Relationship with My Child.home_activity.positive_msg: That's great! Making one-on-one time a regular activity will mean a lot to Your Child. You can also make other routines with your child, like having a meal together or going for a walk. It will help your child feel secure and loved.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.home_activity.negative_msg:
That's OK! Beginning something new takes time. You might want to start with something simple, like creating a time when you and Your Child already do something together. ‚öΩ 

For example, having dinner or going for a walk. Ask Your Child for ideas on which routines could be useful for them. They might surprise you! ‚è∞üçöüö≤
Improve My Relationship with My Child.congratulations.msg_list:
Well done! ‚≠ê You have now learnt the three steps of creating daily routines with your child. 
You have completed @(fields.c_n_mod_compl +1) out of @fields.c_n_mod lessons in the course, Improve my Relationship with My Child. ‚≠ê

Improve My Relationship with My Child.introduction.msg_list: üòÉüò£üòîThis lesson is about noticing your and Your Child‚Äôs feelings during One-on-One Time.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.importance.msg_list:
Noticing our own emotions helps us make clear decisions and act in a nurturing way with Your Child and ourselves.

‚≠ê Noticing and Talking about feelings with Your Child will help them learn how to express and regulate themselves. 

üëåThey will learn that all feelings are okay - even the unpleasant ones.
; 
üå∑ You can help by listening to them, thinking about how it must feel for them, and accepting their emotions. 

ü§óThis will help them recognise other people‚Äôs feelings, too.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.quiz.content.1.question: Talking about pleasant feelings is not as important as sharing unpleasant feelings.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
üéâThat‚Äôs correct. 

6Ô∏è‚É£There are six basic emotions: Happy, Sad, Angry, Disgusted, Surprised, and Afraid. 

‚úÖIt‚Äôs important that we talk with our children about ALL of them.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
üëÄ Oops! Good Try!

6Ô∏è‚É£There are six basic emotions: Happy, Sad, Angry, Disgusted, Surprised, and Afraid. 

‚úÖIt‚Äôs important that we talk with our children about ALL of them.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.quiz.content.2.question: Here‚Äôs another one: Boys should not share when they are feeling sad or afraid.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.quiz.content.2.feedback_correct:
üéâ You are right! 

‚≠ê It is important that both children learn how to share their feelings. 

üíô Children will learn that it is okay to feel sad or afraid and to ask for help when they need it.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.quiz.content.2.feedback_incorrect:
üëÄ Oops! Good Try!

‚≠ê It is important that both children learn how to share their feelings. 

üíô Children will learn that it is okay to feel sad or afraid and ask for help when they need it.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.quiz.content.3.question: Last one: As parents, we can also share our feelings with our children.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.quiz.content.3.feedback_correct:
üéâ Correct! 

üå± Sharing our own feelings with our children in a calm way shows them how to do it themselves.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.quiz.content.3.feedback_incorrect:
üëÄOops! Good Try!

üå± Sharing our own feelings with our children in a calm way shows them how to do it themselves.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.intro: Let‚Äôs see how {F3_MOTHER} helps her girl persist with a difficult activity during one-on-one time
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.text.1:
{F3_MOTHER}: {F3_DAUGHTER_7}, I have 5 minutes to spend One-on-One Time with you. What would you like to do?
{F3_DAUGHTER_7}: Let‚Äôs play with the ball outside!
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.text.2:
{F3_DAUGHTER_7}: I‚Äôm no good at this.
{F3_MOTHER}: I can see that your hands are tight and you are speaking loudly. It looks like you are upset, {F3_DAUGHTER_7}. It‚Äôs not easy, let‚Äôs practise a little bit more. I know you can do it.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.text.3:
{F3_MOTHER}: Five catches in a row! You seem really proud to have made it to five, {F3_DAUGHTER_7}!
{F3_DAUGHTER_7}: Let‚Äôs do 10!
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.text.4: {F3_MOTHER}: I am very happy to be able to spend this special time with you, {F3_DAUGHTER_7}.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.intro: 6Ô∏è‚É£ Here are 6 tips for how you can help Your Child learn how to cope with their emotions: LEARN, NOTICE, OPEN, TALK, SHARE and CARE
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.1.text:
1Ô∏è‚É£ LEARN
üí° Learn about different emotions. There are 6 basic emotions, all of which provide us with a very specific message:  
üòÉHappy: Keep doing things that make you feel good.  
üòîSad: Something important in your life needs attention.
üî¥Angry: Stand up for ourselves and set limits.
üò£Disgusted: Move away from what we don't like.
üëÄSurprised: Stop and pay attention for a moment.
üö©Afraid: Run away from danger.
üé® As children get older, they learn to identify lots of other emotions, like feeling excited, frustrated, proud, lonely, peaceful, guilty, or confused.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.2.text:
2Ô∏è‚É£ NOTICE
üëÄ Begin observing these 6 emotions in yourself and in Your Child.
üòÉüòíüòîüò£Notice how each emotion feels in your body.  
 
üòÉ You can also notice pleasant emotions such as a sense of peace, happiness, or calmness.
üíô Noticing can also allow children to appreciate a beautiful moment or feeling of love!
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.3.text:
3Ô∏è‚É£ OPEN
Be open, notice üëÄ, and listen üëÇ to Your Child when they share how they are feeling. 
üíõ Accept how you and Your Child feel. Remember your and their bodies are sending messages about what you both are feeling. Recognize that feelings are important for both.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.4.text:
4Ô∏è‚É£ TALK

üòí It is normal to have difficulty talking about and expressing emotions and feelings. 

üìù Remember, it is also normal to experience feelings in different ways.

‚≠ê When Your Child is feeling an emotion, describe what you are observing in a calm way. For example, 
‚ÄúI notice you‚Äôre stomping your feet, talking loudly, and your face looks a bit upset. Are you feeling angry because you didn‚Äôt get to play outside?‚Äù
You can also help Your Child learn different emotions by using facial expressions and physical movements. Make it into a game
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.5.text:
5Ô∏è‚É£ SHARE

üòÉ Share your own feelings with Your Child. 

For example, I would feel the same way if I couldn‚Äôt go out when I wanted to. 

 üéàThis sets a good example and shows Your Child that it's okay to share their own feelings.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.6.text:
6Ô∏è‚É£ CARE

üå∑ Use physical and verbal support to make Your Child feel accepted and loved. 

‚≠êJump with your child a little bit to shake out anger or take some deep breaths to calm down. These are some of the ways to deal with your emotions. 

üíö Remind Your Child that you are there for them and that they can always talk to you.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.video.message:
Press Play ‚ñ∂Ô∏è to learn 6Ô∏è‚É£ six tips to learn how to notice feelings during one-on-one time

1Ô∏è‚É£ LEARN
2Ô∏è‚É£ NOTICE
3Ô∏è‚É£ OPEN
4Ô∏è‚É£ TALK
5Ô∏è‚É£ SHARE
6Ô∏è‚É£ CARE
Improve My Relationship with My Child.audio.message:
Press Play ‚ñ∂Ô∏è to learn 6Ô∏è‚É£ six tips to learn how to notice feelings during one-on-one time 

1Ô∏è‚É£ LEARN
2Ô∏è‚É£ NOTICE
3Ô∏è‚É£ OPEN
4Ô∏è‚É£ TALK
5Ô∏è‚É£ SHARE
6Ô∏è‚É£ CARE
Improve My Relationship with My Child.home_activity.activity:
Home Activity! During one-on-one time today, notice Your Child‚Äôs feelings. Talk to Your Child by describing both your own feelings and the feelings of Your Child.

Can you do it today?
Improve My Relationship with My Child.home_activity.positive_msg: This will make such a big difference. Great job! ‚≠ê
Improve My Relationship with My Child.home_activity.negative_msg: That‚Äôs okay. Try to make time this week.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.congratulations.msg_list:
Well done! ‚≠ê You have now learnt how to notice your child‚Äôs feelings during one-on-one time.
You have completed @(fields.c_n_mod_compl +1) out of @fields.c_n_mod lessons in the course, Improve my Relationship with My Child. ‚≠ê

Improve My Relationship with My Child.module_name: Keeping Calm When We Are Stressed
Improve My Relationship with My Child.introduction.msg_list: This lesson is about how we can stay calm and manage our anger when dealing with stressful moments with our children. üíö
Improve My Relationship with My Child.importance.msg_list:
As you began noticing feelings, you would have noticed feelings of anger, frustration or sadness. 

üå∑ We love our children, but stress from caregiving and other events can make us feel angry. This is a normal part of life! 

üí° It is important for us to try to stay calm in order to help manage our anger so we do not hurt others.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.quiz.content.1.question: When I am angry at my child, I should show that I am angry so they stop misbehaving.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
üéâ That‚Äôs correct! 

üíõ It can be very difficult when your child is misbehaving, but you should try to manage your own stress and check your anger before doing anything. 

üå± Taking deep breaths will help. Being angry may cause you to say or do things you will later regret.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
üëÄOops! Good Try!

üíõ It can be very difficult when your child is misbehaving, but you should try to manage your own stress and check your anger before doing anything. 

üå± Taking deep breaths will help. Being angry may cause you to say or do things you will later regret.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.intro: {F2_GRANDFATHER} is about to spend one-on-one time with {F2_SON_8} but finds the living room is a mess. He notices that this makes her feel angry.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.text.1: {F2_GRANDFATHER} (thinking): I‚Äôm feeling really angry. I am tired and my head feels hot. My mouth and throat are tight. I just want to shout at {F2_SON_8}.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.text.2: {F2_GRANDFATHER} (thinking): I will Take a Pause and put on my favourite song.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.text.3: {F2_GRANDFATHER} (thinking): I am feeling a little better. I can think more clearly about what to do to support my little boy.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.text.4: {F2_GRANDFATHER}: {F2_SON_8}, very good job doing your homework. You might be feeling tired now. Let's take a 5-minute break, and after that, we can play a game together to quickly pick up the toys.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.text.5: {F2_GRANDFATHER}: Thank you for doing your part to keep the house clean, {F2_SON_8}! I‚Äôm so proud of your effort.  Oh! It is our one-on-one time. What would you like to do?
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.intro: There are four steps to keeping calm in stressful situations: BE CALM, QUICK, CLEAR, and POSITIVE.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.1.text:
1Ô∏è‚É£ *BE CALM*

‚úÖ Be aware of your own feelings.

‚úÖTake care of your emotions.

‚úÖRemember your goal: make Your Child feel loved and secure.

‚úÖAct effectively: Take a pause or a few breaths before asking Your Child to do something else.

‚úÖ Speak with Your Child in a calm voice.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.2.text:
2Ô∏è‚É£ *BE QUICK*

‚è∞ There are other things you can do to help manage unwanted behaviour before it becomes stressful. 

‚ú®Praise something positive that your child did today. 

‚ú®Understand their feelings. For example, it may feel boring to pick up toys after having fun or ending a big task. 


‚ú®Ask your child to do something else, and distract them before the unwanted behaviour begins or gets worse. 


‚ú®Invite Your Child in a chore you are doing. You can ask Your Child to think of a fun and quick way of doing the chores differently. 


üí° This is much easier than using consequences after they do something!
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.3.text:
3Ô∏è‚É£ *BE CLEAR*

‚úÖ Rather than saying what you DON‚ÄôT want, tell your child what you DO want them to do.

For example, say:

‚ú® ‚ÄúPlease speak more softly.‚Äù

‚ú® ‚ÄúRemember to walk inside the house.‚Äù

This way, it is easier for them to follow! ‚≠ê
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.4.text:
4Ô∏è‚É£ *BE POSITIVE*

‚úÖ Praise your child when they behave well!

‚úÖ Redirecting your child to a positive behaviour will help you manage the situation.

‚úÖ It will also help them know what you expect from them!

Improve My Relationship with My Child.home_activity.activity:
Home Activity! Remember to use these four steps if you start feeling stressed or angry during one-on-one time with your child. You can also share them with another member of your family. Sharing these tips will be great for everyone‚Äôs well-being. ‚û°Ô∏è

Can you share these tips today?
Improve My Relationship with My Child.home_activity.positive_msg: Amazing! ‚ú® Over the next few days, try to keep calm and redirect your child from a negative behaviour to a positive one before it gets worse.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.home_activity.negative_msg: That's OK! üìù Start by practising to Take a Pause even when you feel okay. This will help you be more ready when you feel stressed. ‚≠ê
Improve My Relationship with My Child.congratulations.msg_list:
